item.title: Build your own tiny debian docker image
item.description: Docker This guide assumes you know the basics to docker and assumes it has been installed. This guide will be using a debian variant host environment. TL;DR If you can’t be bothered, you can grab my prebuilt 57MB base image by using: $ docker pull tiggilyboo/base alternatively use it by creating a dockerfile: FROM tiggilyboo/base RUN <some bash commands> CMD ["/bin/bash"] Why? So, no matter what you are hosting on a docker container, a typical image can include all sorts of unneccisary packages - paired with the fact that docker provides a unique overlay file system which is additive, there is no reason to include these packages.
